rComments: Pay attention to the other  ratings for LALS124-I wish I had! Course was interesting, but Ana consistently asked for opinions on material but would cut people off if it wasn't EXACTLY what she was looking for. Then would get mad because no one participated. Wonder why!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!! She might be an amazing Professor when it comes to Portuguese, but Brazilian Cinema was a total joke. She expected us to learn the entire history of Brazil in the first 3 weeks of class, and she belittled students she didn't feel were 'trying hard enough'. I left this class consistently upset, and worried about my grade.

Ana Maria is my favorite professor at UCSC so far. She pushes her students and believes in them. Her faith in me pushed me to work harder than I ever thought I could. Her class is intimate and she develops personal relationships with everybody. Ana Maria is hard on her students but I guarantee she will bring the best out of you. Take it! Tchau!

Ana Maria is quite a challenging professor whose classes are hard to pass. The grade will entirely depend on the willingness of the student to learn Portuguese. With given effort, you will have great command over Portuguese. However, she does expect a lot from her students and will point out those who don't do the work. The effort is worth the gain

It's not the tough work in class that gets to you. She's a mean lady. She's condescending and she's definitely not above calling on those that are clearly struggling for the sake of putting them under pressure. She loves to call people out and let the class know you were absent or you didn't turn in an assignment or that you "could do better".

Ana Maria is by far one of the best professors I've had at UCSC. She is organized, passionate and gets to the point. You absolutely cannot slack in her courses, but you get so much out of them. She's always willing to help if she sees you making an effort. If you have a good grasp on any romance language consider taking the advanced course.

Take this from someone who took a year of Portuguese with her. She displays draconian teaching techniques. Which is especially problematic considering most of her students are ESL students who need her to be more clear/helpful. Be prepared to do A LOT of ass kissing, your grade will reflect how much she likes you/doesn't like you.

Ana expects her students to be insanely responsible. She only accepts absences if there is an absolute emergency - life or death. Demands a doctor's note if you're sick for the day you are sick, a day later is unacceptable. She's great regarding the topic; she's passionate and full of information. DO NOT take this class for an easy GE. It's work.

Ana Maria is by far one of the best professors I've ever had. She's tough but she puts a lot of work into the course and expects the same from her students. By the end of the series, if you work, you will be surprised at how much Portuguese you can speak. Overall, amazing professor.

Ana wasn't helpful at all and she grades veryyy hard! She expects a lot from her students. 2 midterms, 1 final paper. Attendance is mandatory or grades will be jeopardized. She expects every one to participate in class. Worth 20% of your grade! If she isn't interested in what you're saying, she will cut you off! Overall, bad experience!!!

I thought this class would be a good extra class for a GE, however, I would strongly suggest not taking this class unless you are very passionate about Brazilian Culture. I enjoyed the class but if I had known how intensive it was going to be I wouldn't have taken it. Ana expects a lot from every student and you're graded very harshly for tests.

Very dedicated professor who expects hard work in return. Take class if you are serious about learning the language. We definitely used the dictionary while "Pois Nao" was not so much. Tests almost every week. 1 pg compositions in Port. and film reviews on a Port. language film of her choice every week. Amazing professor but very blunt. Oral exams!

She is a great lecturer and works hard. Because of that she expects nothing but the same from you. Besides teaching the language, she wants you to learn the cultural aspect of brasil which makes a huge difference. If you really want to learn portuguese take her class. No doubt! She is just awesome

Professora Seara is great. She expects a lot from her students but she is a passionate, intelligent fire-cracker who will gives just as much back. If you are a slacker, don't take her class, but if you have a genuine interest in languages and Brazilian culture you will get the best introduction to Portuguese!

Ana is one of the best language professors on campus. Although the class can be tedious and time consuming, she truly wants all of her students to leave her class with a solid understanding of Portuguese. You must work hard in her class, but it is worth it in the end.

Ana Maria is by far the best language teacher at UC Santa Cruz.  It's an intensive language course, so if you don't like doing work or going to class this is not the right course for you.  All of the work is 100% worth it if you have any interest in Portuguese or Brazil.

Meh. She's interesting, but gets angry when we don't agree with her. Thinks we're Portuguese majors when we're not. Expects a specific point disucessed in papers when she said the essay was open topic.

If you have never considered learning portuguese or going to brazil, Ana Maria with inspire you! She has an incredible knowledge of the language (being from Rio herself) and is such a talented teacher. Homework consists of movie summaries and essays. Her spirit and love for the country are reason enough to travel to Brazil!

ana is amazin. best teacher in the world. Shes very passionate about teaching Portuguese. She makes you get a feel fir Brazil and not only do you fall in love with her, but with the country and culture as well!

Ana Maria is a wonderful professor. She is very helpful, and wants her students to succeed. Her exams are fair (she gives study guides). You must attend class, and take lots of notes. Assigned readings and films are important. Best language teacher I've ever had, fun class!

Ana is great!  She is always willing to help and really doesn't want to fail anyone, so if you ever have a problem with something she would rather you did it well and turned it in late than rush it and do poorly.  if you abuse that luxury though she will take it away from you, so be careful.

Ana is amazing! the class work escalates towards the end cause we never have enough time to do everything she wants, but an Amazing language experience. I thought it was much more fun/easier to learn than french. small classes, relaxed atmosphere, became my favorite class.

Ana Maria is a jewel..If you want to learn Brazilian Portuguese she is the master... Since she is the only Portuguese teacher at Ucsc..she gets very very cranky twords the end of the Spring quarter..She is sassy and very smart...If you have the drive she h
aprenda portuguese
She's the best language teacher I've ever had. I was really interested in taking the class before I enrolled but her teaching made me want to learn Portuguese even more. Take the class!

I am taking a language class with her and its ok. shes really strick about it, and is on ur case if u dont show up. Her film class on the other hand is so much fun,the movie reviewed were easy, the test barely interfers with ur grade,believe me,i didnt get A's on the test but got an A in the class
Best language teacher I've ever had. I was always real bad at Spanish in high school, but managed to learn Portuguese remarkably well with the help of Ana Maria.
